newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT-LatAm ADRs tread water ahead of weekend.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT-LatAm ADRs tread water ahead of weekend.

text.p: Latin American shares were little changed on paltry U.S. volumes Friday as investors stayed on the sidelines ahead of next week's Fed meeting.
"It is certainly very quiet. People are nervous that the Fed is going to raise rates at next Tuesday's meeting," a trader said.
Brazil's Telebras was one of the region's biggest blue chip gainers, rising one percent, or 7/8 to 80-5/8 by early afternoon.
"I think you're seeing a bit of short-covering there, with people squaring up their positions ahead of the week," one trader said.

Most other Latin American shares barely moved, however, with Telmex's American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) off 1/8 at 32-1/2, YPF down 1/8 at 22-7/8, Telefonica de Argentina up 1/4 at 25-1/4, and CTC sliding 1/4 to 98-3/8.
Mexico's Televisa inched up 1/8 to 29-7/8 after the company said it would get $600 million in cash and an equity stake in the new PanAmSat company formed by PanAmSat and Hughes Electronics.
"This has been expected for a while, so to a large extent, the news is already in the price," a trader said.
